> <OLD>
>
> DINOBOT let out a nod then, and hissed, "We fight the MAXIMALS when they are
> weak, and when we can pick them apart and cull them at our leisure."
> Hopefully even RIPPERSNAPPER would get the idea that engaging an unknown
> gropu of Maximals a mere few kilometers from the ARK an din range of the
> heavy cannons atop it -and- the rest of the MAXIMAL army was a stupid idea.
>
>
> Then again this -was- RIPPERSNAPPER they were talking about.
>
> DINOBOT grinned, "We'll bury them in thier own tunnel and iether let thier
> folk be desperately focused on rescuing them or cut them off and eliminate
> them ourselves."
>
> For now, he went back tos canning the horizon then, hoping that they could
> get dug in underground before the ARK's continuous scanners would pick them
> up.

<NEW>

So far the ARK scanners did not appear to have picked them up, at
least not judging by the ARK itself. They were a little outside
immediate scanning range, and it would only be a deliberate effort to
scan the location that would easily reveal their location.

They were reasonably safe so long as the proper precautions were kept.

RIPPERSNAPPER and BLOT disappeared near to the cave, presumably they
were digging.

Off to one side a human was kneeling in the brush, then a second,
looking at the PREDACONS, but neither of them daring to move. Two
males.

They gestured to each other and then made to back away, hoping to stay
unnoticed.

> <OLD>
>
> There, far away, stealted over was BLACKARACHNIA, who gazed over at the
> ARK..  "oh, to be alone for a day.."  Stroking at her chin, wishing she
> still had her access codes and overrides to it from so long ago.
>
> And so she went, giving her 'report' to TARANTALUS and slinking over towards
> the underside of the heavily retrofitted VANGUARD class craft.

<NEW>

TARANULUS accepted the report, at least a recording of it was taken.
It is apparent that he was otherwise engaged, perhaps dealing with
ANTAGONY.

And as far as BLACKARAKNIA'S override codes, yes they all been taken
from her by TARANULUS, but she was more than skilled enough to learn
new ones . . . or perhaps have some secreted away somewhere that she
could recover.

(TAG)

- Preston
